page.title: 07Cockermouth music centre
page.content: The music centre is held every saturday morning at the Castlegate site of Cockermouth school. It caters for the Cockermouth and district children (roughly 160) whose ages range from 7-18. 120 of them are primary school children. A variety of instruments are played ranging from recorders to basoon tubas to saxaphones. The main organiser is Richard Bennet, who is aided by three members of staff. About five concerts are held each year, at least one a term. Performances are given by two wind bands, an orchestra and a string, brass and recorder ensemble. Money to run the centre is provided by Cumbria county council and from donations by audiences. The aim of the centre is to make music fun for players and listeners.
